fractal

Class Palette

  • java.lang.Object
    • fractal.Palette
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Palette
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a palette that layers will use to color themselves. It stores a color gradient and a color value for the inside of fractals.
    Author:
    Calvin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int size
      The number of colors and data points the palette can store

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Palette()
      Creates a simple black to white gradient with 100% opacity with 1000 colors.
      Palette(java.lang.String filePath, boolean remove)
      Creates a palette object from a filepath.

    • Field Detail

      • size

        public int size
        The number of colors and data points the palette can store

    • Constructor Detail

      • Palette

        public Palette()
        Creates a simple black to white gradient with 100% opacity with 1000 colors. It sets the background color to black.

      • Palette

        public Palette(java.lang.String filePath,
               boolean remove)
        Creates a palette object from a filepath.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path of the palette to be created
        remove - whether or not to delete the palette after loading it in

        public java.lang.Double getOpacityAtPoint(int x)
        Used to find out what the opacity is at any point on the gradient
        Parameters:
        x - the location on the Palette where the opacity value is requested
        Returns:
        a percent opacity at that point

      • getColorAtPoint

        public java.awt.Color getColorAtPoint(int x)
        used to get the color at any point along the gradient
        Parameters:
        x - the position in palette coordinates (ie, ranging from 0-size) of the point
        Returns:
        the color of the gradient at point x

      • colorAt

        public java.awt.Color colorAt(double d)
        used to find the color a certain percent of the way through the gradient
        Parameters:
        d - a proportion representing a percent of the gradient
        Returns:
        the color at the specified proportion of the gradient
